title: Is it selfish to walk away from a relationship with hopes of coming back to it later? If the purpose is to grow as individuals and truly figure out what it is both of you want. What if you don’t WANT to leave but you think you HAVE to? - Quora

response.answer_text: Don’t do it. This is emotional abuse and a way to control another person for not meeting your standards. If you leave a person when life gets tough, but you only go back to them when they are doing well, that make you shallow. It’s best to not think that way, because if you are single, you can’t get angry at them for dating someone else. They aren’t your “property” anymore. You have to be ok with that. You can choose to “separate” for a while for maybe a month and come back. But not any longer. I had a guy do this to me. He cried and told me on the phone that he still loved me and that it wasn’t about anyone else, he just wanted to have time to get his life together and didn’t have time to be in a relationship with me. So I was understanding. He broke up with me but still kept meeting with me to hook up FOR A YEAR. It would be 2 weeks, then it dwindled down to once a month, then every 2 months. I kept running back to him thinking that he made up his mind and we were getting back together. I was waiting for him to “figure himself out”… and then I found out from coworkers and friends that he was meeting his ex again (the whole time he was still seeing me) and dating other girls from work. He put me in a sense of false hope, broke my heart, and wasted my time. It fucked me up so much that I’ve had to see a therapist and be put on medications after having numerous mental breakdowns. He is now living with his ex on the opposite side of the country and I am now happily dating someone else. If the both of you can’t grow together, then don’t stay together.
